title: Update revealed hidden button label to English after No button cracks

requirements.text: Update the user-facing label text of the hidden button that is revealed after the “No” button cracks/falls so it is in English (playful tone, emojis allowed), while keeping all existing behavior unchanged: it must remain clickable, visually distinct, and must invoke the same success/celebration flow as the main “Yes” button (confetti + floating hearts + navigate to the existing success screen/message).

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: When the user successfully clicks the dodging “No” button, the crack-and-fall animation still plays and the hidden button still appears underneath.
The revealed hidden button’s label is English (no non-English words) and retains a playful tone (emojis permitted).

Clicking the revealed hidden button triggers the exact same behavior as clicking the main “Yes” button (confetti overlay + floating hearts overlay + existing success screen with the existing success message).
The revealed hidden button is clickable on both desktop and mobile (no pointer-events/z-index issues), and remains within the visible proposal area.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not introduce external animation libraries; continue using existing Tailwind/global CSS keyframes approach.
Backend must remain single-actor; no backend changes are required for this UI-only update.
nonGoals: Changing the quiz content, quiz step count, or quiz flow logic.
Changing the main proposal text (“So now there’s only one thing left to ask…” / “Will you be my Valentine?”).
Adding new backend persistence or Internet Identity changes.
